full_summary:
### Dental Sterilization Audits Announcement (Tender Reference: PW-23-01029996)
#### Background and Purpose
The Correctional Service Canada is seeking a contractor to conduct dental sterilization audits at 10 institutions within the Ontario region. The audits are intended to assess compliance with on-site dental sterilization guidelines, ensuring the health and safety of inmates.

#### Requirements and Deliverables
The successful contractor shall:
* Conduct yearly dental sterilization audits of the 10 institutions.
* Meet the requirements set out by the Canadian Safety Association (CSA) for sterilization of dental equipment.
* Prepare and submit a written report to the institutional Chief of Health Care and Regional Manager of Public Health within 30 days of the audit.

#### Timelines and Reminders
The tender closing date is March 28, 2023, at 2:00 PM EDT. The proposed contract is for a period of five (5) years, with an option to extend for two (2) additional one-year periods.

#### Essential Qualifications
The contractor must demonstrate the following essential qualifications:
* A minimum of 5 years of experience performing sterilization audits.
* Certified professionals with experience in infection control and dental sterilization.
* Ability to work at all institutions within the Ontario region, adhering to institutional requirements and security procedures.

#### Trade Agreements and Procurement Details
This procurement is subject to the Canada Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and Canada Korea Free Trade Agreement. The estimated value of the contract, including options, is $177,420.85 (GST/HST extra).

#### Contact Information
For inquiries and statement of capabilities submissions, please contact Danielle Murdoch at danielle.murdoch@csc-scc.gc.ca or 343-422-4831.

#### Closing Date and Time
February 28, 2023, at 2:00 PM EDT.

#### Post-Closing Information
This announcement is for information purposes only, and is subject to change. No further updates will be provided unless there are significant developments. The successful contractor will be announced once the tender evaluation process is complete.
